metadata.title: CVE-2018-7889 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: gui2/viewer/bookmarkmanager.py in Calibre 3.18 calls cPickle.load on imported bookmark data, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted .pickle file, as demonstrated by Python code that contains an os.system call.

criterions.comment: calibre package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0+dfsg-1').
